conclusion: Analyze the path of the light ray through the prism using refraction and geometry.

The prism is a right triangular prism with a right angle at B. AB = BC = 8 cm, triangle ABC is isosceles right triangle. Angle OAB = 60 degrees, OA = 2 cm. Light enters perpendicularly from O along AD.
Light enters perpendicularly to AD and travels along AD until it hits AB or BC. It will first hit AB.
Angle of incidence at AB is 60 degrees because angle OAB = 60 degrees.
Apply Snell's Law at AB: n1 = 1 (air), n2 = sqrt(2) (prism), theta1 = 60 degrees. Calculate theta2 = sin^(-1)(sqrt(6)/4) ≈ 35.26 degrees.
Light ray refracts at AB and travels inside the prism at an angle of 35.26 degrees with respect to the normal to AB.
Light ray will exit the prism at BC because it is the next boundary. Angle of incidence at BC is 35.26 degrees.
Apply Snell's Law at BC: n1 = sqrt(2) (prism), n2 = 1 (air), theta1 = 35.26 degrees. Calculate theta2 = sin^(-1)(0.831) ≈ 56.31 degrees.
Light ray exits the prism at an angle of 56.31 degrees with respect to the normal to BC.
Direction of the light ray when it exits the prism is 56.31 degrees from the normal to BC.
